title: Pecan-Crusted Tilapia
summary: Pecan-Crusted Tilapia might be just the main course you are searching for. Watching your figure? This pescatarian recipe has 353 calories, 40g of protein, and 11g of fat per serving. For $3.45 per serving, this recipe covers 30% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. This recipe serves 4. 1 person were impressed by this recipe. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes about 45 minutes. It is brought to you by My Recipes. Head to the store and pick up vegetable oil, snapper fillets, lemon wedges, and a few other things to make it today. To use up the dry breadcrumbs you could follow this main course with the Gluten Free Dairy Free Coconut Tarts as a dessert. Overall, this recipe earns an outstanding spoonacular score of 85%. Pecan Crusted Tilapia, Pecan-Crusted Tilapia, and Pecan-Crusted Tilapia are very similar to this recipe.

winePairing.pairingText: Pinot Grigio, Gruener Veltliner, and Pinot Noir are great choices for Fish. Fish is as diverse as wine, so it's hard to pick wines that go with every fish. A crisp white wine, such as a pinot grigio or Gr√ºner Veltliner, will suit any delicately flavored white fish. Meaty, strongly flavored fish such as salmon and tuna can even handle a light red wine, such as a pinot noir. The Esperto Pinot Grigio with a 4.5 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 10 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Esperto Pinot Grigio
productMatches.description: Brilliant straw color with reflections of gold. Crisp and clean with delicate nose of orange flower and wild rose with apricot, white peach and orange peel. Crisp, dry and well structured with golden apple and citrus.Wonderfully versatile. Excellent as an apertif and the perfect complement to light appetizers, salads, grilled chicken and fresh seafood. Enjoy well chilled.

instructions: Combine first 5 ingredients in a shallow dish. Combine buttermilk and hot sauce in a medium bowl; place flour in a shallow dish. Dredge 1 fillet in flour. Dip in buttermilk mixture; dredge in breadcrumb mixture. Repeat procedure with remaining fillets, flour, buttermilk mixture, and breadcrumb mixture.                                                                                                Heat 1 1/2 teaspoons oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Add 2 fillets; cook 3 minutes on each side or until fish flakes easily when tested with a fork. Repeat procedure with remaining oil and fillets. Serve with lemon wedges.

steps.step: Combine first 5 ingredients in a shallow dish.

Combine buttermilk and hot sauce in a medium bowl; place flour in a shallow dish. Dredge 1 fillet in flour. Dip in buttermilk mixture; dredge in breadcrumb mixture. Repeat procedure with remaining fillets, flour, buttermilk mixture, and breadcrumb mixture.
Heat 1 1/2 teaspoons oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat.
Add 2 fillets; cook 3 minutes on each side or until fish flakes easily when tested with a fork. Repeat procedure with remaining oil and fillets.
